org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin

Interface WaitForCardRemovalBlocking

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ObservableReader, ObservableReaderNotifier, Reader

    public interface WaitForCardRemovalBlocking
extends ObservableReaderNotifier
    Interface to be implemented by the readers able to handle natively the card removal process.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservableReader

    • Method Detail

      • waitForCardAbsentNative

        boolean waitForCardAbsentNative()
        Wait until the card disappears.

        This method must be implemented by the plugin's reader class when it implements the WaitForCardRemovalBlocking interface. The reader implementation must manage the card removal process itself. (for example by using the analogous waitForCardAbsent method in the case of a plugin based on smartcard.io [PC/SC]).

        In the case where the reader plugin is not able to handle the card removal process itself (not implementing the WaitForCardRemovalBlocking interface, then it is managed by the isCardPresentPing method defined in this class.

        Returns true if the card has disappeared.

        *

        Returns:
        presence status
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the card has failed

      • stopWaitForCardRemoval

        void stopWaitForCardRemoval()
        Interrupts the waiting of the removal of the card
